intro: Dorstenia radiata, commonly known as the "Star Tortilla Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its unique, waxy, and often ribbed leaves that resemble tortillas, hence its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Dorstenia radiata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
